title: Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering Technology
description: Electrical Engineering Technology (EET) is a branch of engineering education that emphasizes the practical aspects of engineering rather than abstract concepts or theories. It is a blend of the application of science, engineering knowledge and technical skills used in support of engineering activities. Kennesaw State University’s EET program is ranked 11th in the nation, based on student enrollment.
careers: Electrical and Electronics Drafters, Electrical and Electronic Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Electro-Mechanical and Mechatronics Technologists and Technicians, Non-Destructive Testing Specialists
school: Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering
